content: "An enormous island of trash twice the size of Texas is floating in the Pacific Ocean somewhere between San Francisco and Hawaii. " This may not fall within the exact definition of a conspiracy theory, but what else would be the driving force to make such a statement that has yet to be proven unless it was some kind of conspiracy theory and/or political driven motive? By the tree huggers maybe? "Chris Parry with the California Coastal Commission in San Francisco said the so-called Great Pacific Garbage Patch, has been growing a brisk rate since the 1950s, The San Francisco Chronicle reported Friday. The trash stew is 80 percent plastic and weighs more than 3.5 million tons. "At this point, cleaning it up isn't an option," Parry said. "It's just going to get bigger as our reliance on plastics continues." "Parry said using canvas bags to cart groceries instead of using plastic bags is a good first step to reducing reliance on plastics, the newspaper said." "http://www.physorg.com/news112248742.html" The problem with this is it has never been seen..but yet it's all over the net. Flotsam and jetsam Traditionally, flotsam and jetsam are words that describe specific kinds of debris in the ocean. Historically the words had specific nautical meanings, with legal consequences, but in modern usage they came to mean any kind of marine debris.[citation needed] Wikipedia.

title: Giant garbage patch floating in Pacific

content: I heard of that, but I can assure you it was NOT THERE in 1966. As I sailed thru that area then in a 67' sailboat, and the ocean was clean, tho we did find some glass Japanese fishing floats. But that was IT, flying fish, squid, and Tuna now and then was it for junk.
reply: I heard of that, but I can assure you it was NOT THERE in 1966. As I sailed thru that area then in a 67' sailboat, and the ocean was clean, tho we did find some glass Japanese fishing floats. But that was IT, flying fish, squid, and Tuna now and then was it for junk.

content: As the polywhatevers slowly biodegrade they have infested the entire water cycle to the point that everyone has trace amounts in their blood. Not a conspiracy, just sloppy housekeeping.

content: To borrow a phrase from Forest Gump... I'm not a smart man. But that just seems to me that would be the sort of thing people would notice! Lots of people sailing around and no one has seen this thing??? You can also get commercial satillite shots of anywhere in the world. And no one has seen this thing???? Come on... I'm not smart... But I'm smarter than this!

content: There is a lot of trash floating around in the ocean. Thats not including all the oil thats been spilled over the years. Including all the water from our streets that run off into rivers and back out to the ocean. Something to think about. Is this legal? I don't know,but its fun isn't?!
